basics.name: Marco Lussetti
basics.label: IT Solutions Architect & Full Stack Developer
basics.summary:
IT Solutions Architect for the City of Kamloops, with a broad portfolio spanning infrastructure, networking, databases, and development.

My primary background is in full stack and mobile development (Python+Django, Typescript+React, Cordova/Android Native/React Native).

My primary research interests are the areas of generative adversarial neural networks (particularly in a healthcare context), big data & big data reduction, and cloud vs local computing.

I have longstanding interests in data mining/scraping, different paradigms/approaches to programming languages, and data analysis.

education.institution: Thompson Rivers University, Kamloops, BC, Canada

work.summary: I provide architectural designs and reviews, procedures development, and training for the City's wide ranging of computing and IT needs.

highlights: Worked on Generative Adversarial Neural Networks (GANNs) for the creation of synthetic and unencumbered healthcare records.
Contributed to research on decision making concerning modeling techniques in a group setting.
Cross-platform mobile application using React.js & Cordova. App coded in TypeScript and deployed on iOS and Android. Integrated animation assets created in Adobe After Effects using Lottie Web
Performed data analysis associated with main project using Python, Jupyter Notebooks, & Matplotlib
Additional front-end development in AngularJS and back-end development in Python/Django/Tastypie.

volunteer.summary: 12 years of volunteering in a number of community-elected roles at project and global level.
highlights: During my time on Wikimedia I have focused on behind the scenes work (counter-vandalism, task automation and others) and have served or am serving as an administrator on multiple Wikimedia projects (including the English Wikipedia), oversighter (volunteers entrusted with the removal of private information), global Steward (volunteers entrusted with global maintenance and user permission granting roles) as well as many other roles.

volunteer.summary: Coordinated the club's workshops, and personally taught 3 such workshops.
highlights: Django introductory workshop (2017), Python for Data Analysis (2017), Nim introduction (2018)

awards.title: Valedictorian, Faculty of Science
awards.summary: Awarded to a single student per faculty on the basis of academic and other achivements. The student concludes the commencement ceremony on behalf of the graduating class.

awards.title: Dr. Sherman Jen Scholarship for Science
awards.summary: Inauguaral winner.  Awarded on the basis of academic achivements.

publications.name: Big Data Reduction: Lessons Learned from Analyzing One Billion Dota 2 Matches
publications.author: Marco Lussetti, Dyson Fraser
publications.summary:
The availability of large datasets of player choices in popular online computer games presents an opportunity to identify sudden changes in choice patterns and explore what factors may contribute to such changes. However, the size and scope of large datasets (the dataset used was 1.2TB) raises big data reduction problems and the study tackles these issues using very simple and intuitive tools that may be used on single machines with limited computational resources.

This study uses a large dataset of over one billion games played in the online computer game Dota 2 to extract metagame shifts and match them to external events (patches, tournaments).
